Sensor Readout Correction
(for Full CameraLink)

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

Most camera sensors are read out sequentially in the so called raster scan format (line by line from top-left to bottom-right) However, to speed up the data transfer, some sensors can be configured to read out several pixels in parallel. As a result, pixels transferred succeeding over the CamerLink cable are not necessarily neighbouring pixels. The Sensor Readout Correction can reshuffle the pixels on-board of the frame grabber and transfer the grabbed image in the usual raster-scan fashion. All common readout strategies are supported to save computational power of the host system.

Please note that only cameras are supported which deliver a line whose width is divisable by 128. The parameter FG_WIDTH of microDisplay or the SDK is not directly affected by the camera line width restriction. FG_WIDTH cuts off a region of interests from the delivered camera line. It must be divisibly by 16.


Parameters
.

Readout Mode

The parameter Readout Mode selects the pixel reshuffeling schema:

The reshuffeling schemata table consists of twelve basic schemata and their mirrored versions. The mirrored schemata allow to mount line scan cameras in 180 degree fashion when mounting the normal way is not mechanically convinient.




The following figure illustrates the read out schema 12345678> of SMODE_UNCHANGED for the 8 tap full cameras. Read out direction is forward. This read out schema does not require pixel reshuffeling.




The next figure illustrates the read out shema <87654321 of SMODE_REVERSE for the 8 tap full cameras. Reout direction is backward. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_UNCHANGED and performs a line mirroring for correction.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_0 reads out half of the line forwards and half of the line backwards. The number of pixels read out from both halves is divided into groups of 4 neighbouring pixels. A block of 4 pixels from the first half and a block of 4 pixels from the last half are transmitted over CameraLink as a single 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_1 reads out half of the line forwards and half of the line backwards. The number of pixels read out from both halves is divided into groups of 4 neighbouring pixels. A block of 4 pixels from the first half and a block of 4 pixels from the last half are transmitted over CameraLink as a single 8 pixel block. The order of pixels in the second 4 pixel block is mirrored in comparision to SMODE_TAB8_0.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_2 reads out the both line halves forwards. The number of pixels read out from both halves is divided into groups of 4 neighbouring pixels. A block of 4 pixels from the first half and a block of 4 pixels from the last half are transmitted over CameraLink as a single 8 pixel block.





The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_3 reads out the four line quarters forwards. The number of pixels read out from all quarters is divided into groups of 2 neighbouring pixels. A block of 2 pixels from each quarter is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.





The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_4 reads out the four line quarters backwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_3.The number of pixels read out from all quarters is divided into groups of 2 neighbouring pixels. A block of 2 pixels from each quarter is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_5 reads out the first and the second line quarters forwards and the third and the fourth line quarters backwards. The number of pixels read out from all quarters is divided into groups of 2 neighbouring pixels. A block of 2 pixels from each quarter is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.
.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_6 reads out the first line half forwards and the last line half backwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_0. The number of pixels read out from both halves is divided into groups of 4 neighbouring pixels. A block of 4 pixels from the first half and a block of 4 pixels from the last half are transmitted over CameraLink as a single 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_7 reads out the first line half forwards and the last line half backwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_1. The number of pixels read out from both halves is divided into groups of 4 neighbouring pixels. A block of 4 pixels from the first half and a block of 4 pixels from the last half are transmitted over CameraLink as a single 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_8 reads out the both line halves backwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_2. The number of pixels read out from both halves is divided into groups of 4 neighbouring pixels. A block of 4 pixels from the last half and a block of 4 pixels from the first half are transmitted over CameraLink as a single 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_9 reads out the fourth and the third line quarters backwards and the second and the first line quarters forwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_5. The number of pixels read out from all quarters is divided into groups of 2 neighbouring pixels. A block of 2 pixels from each quarter is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_10 reads out the first and the second line quarters forwards and the third and the fourth line quarters backwards. The number of pixels read out from all quaters is divided into groups of 2 neighbouring pixels. A block of 2 pixels from each quarter is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_11 reads out the last and the third line quarters backwards and the second and the first line quarters forwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_10. The number of pixels read out from all quaters is divided into groups of 2 neighbouring pixels. A block of 2 pixels from each quarter is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_12 reads out all eighth parts of the line forwards. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_13 reads out all eighth parts of the line backwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_12. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_14 reads out the first four eighth parts of the line forwards and the last four eighth parts of the line backwards. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_15 reads out the last four eighth parts of the line backwards and the first four eighth parts of the line forwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_14. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_16 reads out the first and second line eighth parts forwards, the third and fourth line eighth parts backwards, the fifth and sixth eighth parts forwards, and the seventh and last eighth parts of the line backwards. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_17 reads out the last and seventh line eighth parts backwards, the sixth and fifth line eighth parts forwards, the fourth and third eighth parts backwards, and the second and first eighth parts of the line forwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_16. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_18 reads out all eighth parts of the line backwards. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_19 reads out all eighth parts of the line forwards. This schema is a mirrored version of SMODE_TAB8_18. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_20 reads out the first four eighth parts backwards and the last four eighth parts of the line forwards. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.




The sensor readout mode SMODE_TAB8_21 reads out the last four eighth parts forwards and the first four eighth parts of the line backwards. The number of pixels read out from all eighth parts is divided into groups of 1 pixel. A block of 1 pixel from each eighth is transmitted over CameraLink as a single concatenated 8 pixel block.
